concept.title: Index elements
concept.shortdesc: The content of the indexterm elements provides the text for the entries in the generated index. indexterm elements can be nested to create secondary and tertiary index entries.

conbody.p: The following elements contain information that processors use to generate indexes.

dlentry.dd: (Unless combined with index-see) Instructs a processor to generate an index entry with a page reference. The start and end attributes on indexterm can specifiy index ranges.
Instructs a processor to generate a redirection to another index entry. The redirection typically has a page reference while the index entry does not.
Instructs a processor to generate a redirection to another index entry. Both the index entry and the redirection typically have page references.

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: Can we remove the word "typically" from the above statements?
27 July 2019: I'm adding additional information here, to clarify the issues:

ul.li: Not all DITA processors support indexing
Indexing is often relevant only to print-based delivery formats.
AFAIK, page references are ONLY relevant to print-based delivery formats.

draft-comment.p: I think my preference would be to have a statement clarifying the above matters at the start of this content, and then avoid wiggle words such as "typically."

conbody.p: How the index elements are combined, the location of indexterm elements, and the hierarchy of the DITA maps all effect how the index elements are processed and the resulting generated index entries.
